Who wants to go for a walk?
My tail is wagging with delight.
Fetch the ball!
Good boy!
Slobbering, chewing, growling, barking.
Sniffing every fire hydrant on the block.
Begging for scraps under the dinner table.
Rolling in something smelly at the park.
Greeting everyone at the door with enthusiasm.
Chasing squirrels up trees.
Digging holes in the backyard for no apparent reason.
Sticking my head out the car window, ears flapping in the wind.
Spinning in circles before lying down.
Bringing you a slobbery tennis ball for the hundredth time today.
Howling along to the ambulance sirens.
Immediately forgetting I was just outside and wanting to go out again.
Protecting the house from the terrifying mailman.
Leaning against your leg for pets.
Doing zoomies across the living room after a bath.
Tilting my head when you make a funny noise.
Following you from room to room, even to the bathroom.
Getting tangled in the leash at the park.
Whimpering at the thunder outside.
Destroying a stuffed toy in under five minutes.
Pawing at your arm until you pet me.
Jumping up to greet visitors, knocking them over.
Snoring loudly while sprawled on the couch.
Eating homework, socks, and anything left on the floor.
Sitting on command for a treat.
Splashing through every puddle on our walk.
Refusing to come inside when called.
Barking at my own reflection in the window.
Stealing food off the counter when no one's looking.
Rolling onto my back for belly rubs.
Playing tug-of-war with a rope toy.
Drooling at the sight of your dinner plate.
Recognizing the word 'walk' no matter how quietly you whisper it.
Pressing my cold wet nose against your hand.
Sleeping at the foot of the bed, taking up all the space.
Greeting you like you've been gone for years, even though it was five minutes.
Chewing on a bone for hours.
Getting excited when you pick up the leash.
Barking at the doorbell, even on TV.
Loyal companion through thick and thin.
Running to greet you the moment you get home.
Learning tricks for treats.
Playing dead, shaking paws, rolling over.
Sniffing other four-legged friends at the park.
Pulling on the leash to chase a bird.
Circling the food bowl before eating.
Whining when left alone.
Perking up ears at distant sounds.
Napping in a sunny spot on the floor.
Getting muddy paws all over the clean floor.
Excitedly waiting for dinner time.
Licking your face to wake you up.
Burying treats in the couch cushions.
Herding the kids around the yard.
Panting happily after a long run.
Shaking water everywhere after swimming.
Carrying a stick twice my size home from the park.
Alerting you to every squirrel, rabbit, and leaf.
Cuddling up next to you on the couch.
Wagging so hard my whole body wiggles.
Playing bow: front legs down, rear end up.
Catching frisbees mid-air.
Snuggling into a pile of warm laundry.
Guarding the family while they sleep.
Getting excited by the jingle of car keys.
Pacing by the door when it's time for a walk.
Carrying my favorite toy everywhere.
Wolfing down dinner in thirty seconds flat.
Sitting patiently while you tie your shoes.
Bounding through fresh snow.
Refusing to walk past the scary garden statue.
Demand barking when the water bowl is empty.
Sniffing every blade of grass thoroughly.
Yelping with joy at the sight of a tennis ball.
Protective growling at strangers.
Flopping down dramatically when tired.
Chasing my own tail in circles.
Nosing open doors that aren't fully closed.
Tracking muddy footprints through the house.
Splooting on the cool kitchen tile.
Howling when the family sings happy birthday.
Nudging my food bowl toward you when hungry.
Sleeping with all four legs in the air.
Getting the hiccups after eating too fast.
Sneezing during playtime.
Herding imaginary sheep in the backyard.
Investigating every shopping bag that comes through the door.
Whimpering in my sleep while dreaming of chasing rabbits.
Sitting on your feet to keep you from leaving.
Finding every stick on the hiking trail.
Drinking from the toilet when nobody's watching.
Getting jealous when you pet another animal.
Doing the happy wiggle dance.
Dropping a toy in your lap repeatedly.
Learning that 'vet' is not a happy word.
